title: Five years ago, Deepika was twice as old as Kanchan. Five years later, Deepika's age will be 5 more than Kanchan's age. What are their present ages? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let, the present age of Deepika be x. And present age of Kanchan be y. Then, According to the quastion. 5 years ago Deepika was twice as old as Kanchan. So, x-5 = 2(y-5) x-5 = 2y - 10 x - 2y = - 5 …(1) NOW, 5 years later Deepika’s age will be 5 more than Kanchan’s age. So, x+5 = (y+5) +5 x+5 = y + 10 x - y = 5 …(2) Now, solving equation (1) and (2) x - 2y = - 5 and x - y = 5, we get y = 10 and x = 15 Hence, the present age of Deepika is 15 years and Kanchan is 10 years old. Answer. Thanks!

Suppose, Deepika’s present age is x years and, Kanchan’s present age is y years. Five years ago their ages were (x-5) and (y-5) respectively and 5 years later their ages were (x+5) and (y+5) respectively. According to question, (x-5) = 2(y-5) (as 5 years ago, Deepika was twice as old as Kanchan) x -5 = 2y - 10 ……….(1) And also, (x +5) = (y + 5) + 10 (as five years later, Deepika's age will be 5 more than Kanchan's age) So, x + 5 = y + 10 x = y +5; Substituting value of x in equation 1, y + 5 - 5 = 2y -10; y = 2y - 10 y = 10 And, x = y + 5 = 10 + 5 = 15. Finally, Deepika’s present age is 15 years And Kanchan’s present age is 10 years.
